doc.field: Subseries VII: Federal Election Campaign Act (FECA) Materials
Subseries VII: Federal Election Campaign Act (FECA) Materials

This subseries, consisting of five linear feet of material, largely contains materials relating to the passage of the 1974 amendments to the Federal Election Campaign Act. The Act requires candidates for national office to disclose donor lists and regulates the The 1974 amendment authorized the creation of the Federal Election Commission, the governing body entrusted with the administration and enforcement of the Act.
Other topics covered in these materials include the Public Documents Act of 1974 and aid to Turkey.

These materials were received by the University Archives from William Sudow. In 1974, Sudow served as the staff director of the House Administration Committee, which also drafted the Presidential Recordings and Materials Preservation Act of 1974 (see Series I, Subseries I, Sub-Subseries I for more information on this Act). See also Series I, Subseries III for further information about Brademas and his tenure on the House Administration Committee.

Materials are generally arranged chronologically, with the Public Documents Act and Turkey materials at the end. Some of the materials were damaged by mold or poor storage conditions prior to accessioning. These materials have been removed from the collection for preservation purposes.
